website_summaries.verdict: A good option for any ceiling fan requiring a control replacement or that lacks one in the first place.
pros: Basic setup for simple control over the ceiling fan
Provides large buttons for common speed settings and an on-off light control
cons: Lack of advanced control features makes the remote more limited in use

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and works as advertised. As noted elsewhere, it beeps whenever you press a button. Unfortunately our OCD dog barked every time it beeped, so I had to remove the beeper. Easy to do - you can pop the case open with a small screw driver and the circuit board drops right out. Then desolder/cut off the speaker component - see before and after pictures below. Do at your own risk, voids warranty, no guarantees etc. etc., but an easy procedure if you want to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Switch box mounting is also an option
customer_reviews.text: Great product that works as advertised. I for one like the "beep" feedback the unit provides. In my case the receiver did not fit in my fan mount. Instead, I mounted the unit in the 3-gang switch box which previously held the old controls for the speed and light. I was then able to affix the remote holder to the switch plate.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Larimore

customer_reviews.title: Universal ceiling fan add on remote.
customer_reviews.text: A great add on item when you want a remote control to turn your ceiling fan on/off,as well as turn the light on/off.I purchased a ceiling fan without a remote for a great sale price,decided to add this item.easy install,Just make sure you have room in ceiling fan for the rèmote box.only 5 wire hookup.Works Great.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I've had one for few years
customer_reviews.text: We had one in bedroom. I ordered another one for the office. It's all good, receiver looks bit bulky, but it fits fine under both of the fan covers. Works 100% reliable. One thing I hate, and I'm taking one star away for is a beep that receiver makes every time it receives signal from remote controller. I took the receiver back out, opened it and popped out the speaker from the board (round black thing with hole in the middle, right in the corner). No more BEEEP!!!!!!! I wish I remembered to do it before I installed it this time
customer_reviews.author: Scoobiemario

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough but uses a non-standard battery
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough controller which works as expected but it takes a 23a 12v micro battery. The unit does come with one but I really don't need another device to buy a one-off batter for. The controller is average sized and there is plenty of room, why the heck design it to take a weird battery? So, it will work for a few years and then one day it won't and I'll have to hunt down the weird little battery for it on Amazon. Guaranteed, the day the battery craps out will be the day I need the fan or fan light to work. Not worth uninstalling and sending back, I'll just deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, be mindful of it fitting
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my hunter fan. Bought this because two rooms in the house don’t have their own dedicated switch for fan and light, so this was a simple solution to that. Only complaint / inconvenience is the size of the control. It wasn’t coming close to fitting inside the little space. This also could be because this fan wasn’t manufactured to have it, so why make the space right? If you have issues like I did, I already had some Velcro that I put on the ceiling and control and that worked. However if I didn’t have it, I’m not sure what crazy solution I would’ve thought up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great  with one  major caveat.
customer_reviews.text: Works well even with LED lights. No flicker. Timer feature on remote is nice. The reciever beeps at each input. Controler is solid and has a positive button feel. My only complaint is that you can't put a second remote in the system. I really, really wanted a second controller. Added comment. One nice thing is that if you flip the wall switch on an off the light goes on even if it was switched off at the remote. Nice for going into a dark room and the remote is not by the door. Kind of a reset/over ride. It is especially useful when you only have a single remote.
customer_reviews.author: John in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Nice remote and slim receiver, but no dimmer
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well. It has a beep function in the receiver that beeps when a command is received which is nice for those times when your unsure if the signal was received... Like adjusting fan speed. And there's a timer function which is great too because my wife will leave a fan running all day in a empty room than whine about the power bill. Only negative is this unit won't dim lights only on or off. The last unit in the bedroom had a dimmer which was nice when you wanted the room darker if someone was sleeping. It's my fault for not checking on the dimmer function or maybe theirs for no listing it plainly.
customer_reviews.author: PJCTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Universal - Yes in the sense it will work with any fan.. but...
customer_reviews.text: I have found that most of these "retrofit" kits don't fit easily into the bases of older fans that never were intended/designed for a remote. To get this unit to work with my fan I had to get a bit creative and zip tie the unit to the side of the dome that covered the electrical box connection. It would not fit inside the dome. Not sure why these retrofits need to be so large, if they could be shrunk down to fit in that space, you could "remote enable" any old ceiling fan setup. But ultimately it worked well once I got it in place.
customer_reviews.author: John Owens

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: very easy installation, took less than 5 minutes. the receiver was smaller than i expected, which is a good thing. it fit in the fan mount housing with some "wiggle room", so it didn't feel cramped. NOTE: the receiver beeps every time the wall switch is turned on, and it beeps whenever any remote button is pressed.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyL

customer_reviews.title: Love the remote
customer_reviews.text: This did fit my fan, but barely. Works great. Compared to the unit I was replacing, this remote feels so much nicer, the timer function is a nice bonus. But the remote chimes every time the remote is touch, with 2 people sharing a room and using the remote or adjusting to different settings, the chime could wake the other person up. I wish there was a way to turn the chime off.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Love it, though installation is not a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient to have a remote that controls the lights and the fan. Only criticism is that it was almost impossible to install. Ceiling fans aren't light, and when you have millimeters to work with in order to get that box to fit in there while trying to line up the screws and jam the fan back up on to them and secure them before going crazy is almost impossible. I still managed to do it, but this was NOT easy, however it was worth it to do it and I am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kostreba

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly, but there are items to consider
customer_reviews.text: This item works as advertised but the wire housing is a little large and it was difficult to fit it inside the fan motor housing without it rubbing the motor when the fan was turned on. We had to take the fan apart 3 times to adjust and use wire and nails (to wrap wire around) to brace it to the ceiling. Although that worked, the fan motor housing doesn't align with all screw holes, but we got it to hold with the ones we could align. The product works perfectly and is convenient if you only have a single switch plate. My suggestion would be to try to manufacture with a smaller housing if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Simple way to add a remote to existing fan
customer_reviews.text: Hardest part was figuring out how to disassemble existing fan on the ceiling but once wires were exposed it was real easy to wire up. Chances are that existing wires were installed to the fan with wirenuts so it should be a simple exercise in disconnecting and essentially inserting this module in the middle; connect wires according to the chart with wirenuts and put everything back together. I would have liked some double sided tape to be include as I had to tape the box to the ceiling in order to clear the rotating fan mechanism on my model.
customer_reviews.author: BuyItOnce

customer_reviews.title: great idea, but junk product
customer_reviews.text: Price point is great and installation was easy. Although the instruction were vague I had this installed within 15 minutes. However after less than 2 weeks, this remote is already giving me problems. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. Very frustrating having to take my ceiling fan back down to remove this item for a return. Don't get me wrong, when it worked it was great! It just did not last long. Therefore this is not even worth my time wasted to install it and have to take it back down 2 weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Carstensen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 to replace old ones. First install;nook problem 10 minutes MAX. Second one, took me 2 hours to install. Would go in 1/3 the way,then 1/2 the way,but would not get it to go in,not even with force! So after about a hour 50 minutes wondering what is wrong,since the other one just slid in;same brand fan same bracket and all. So I took the whole ceiling fan down and put it back up,still wouldn't fit!. Then a little devil appeared on my shoulder and said,try putting it in the other side of the bracket,and it slid right in,perfect fit. Be patient installind;it's not it,it's you☺.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Works well, and the remote is sleek, but has drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: It's a good compact size to fit into standard fan housings. Works well overall. The things I don't like is there is no option to turn off the beep. I didn't know it would make noise when it receives a command. Instructions don't mention anything about it making noise. Also, less importantly, it uses a non-standard 12v battery that's harder to find. Overall though, I'm pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, very helpful
customer_reviews.text: My bedroom fan already has a remote but my kids broke the remote. I was looking for a remote control to connect with my fan and I bought this. It was easy to install and setup. Very clear directions for installing the remote sensor. Remote control is sturdy and not like the old remote which was very fragile. Earlier I use to keep the remote always on the stand as it had delicate buttons but this remote is good quality and buttons are tight. No more issues of broken or not working remote.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Mah

customer_reviews.title: Stylish remote.  Easy install. Get rid of the beep!
customer_reviews.text: Stylish remote, nice lay out. Installs like any other ceiling fan remote. They are all tight fits in canopy and squeezing the wires in. Basic electricy setup 2 power wires in and three out (common, fan and light). Took less than 15 minutes to install, and that includes the time to get out tools and ladder and putting them away when I was done. The beep was annoying, so as another review suggested I popped it open and removed the pizeo beeper- just pluck it out with a pocket knife and it pops right out.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lindemann

customer_reviews.title: Short wires, not ETL or UL listed
customer_reviews.text: I can give this only 3 stars because it’s not UL or ETL listed, and that the wires are ridiculously short. At least 1/2 as short as the name brand product that broke that it was replacing which created some issues trying to get all the wires in the junction box. I may end up replacing it for something that’s certified. But it works, so it gets 3 stars. And the beeping really is annoying, they could drop the volume a bit.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyStuff

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old remote for an old ceiling fan. For some reason the old remote kept going through 9 volt batteries within 3 months average. Installation of receiver can be a little tricky with an old heavier model fan, otherwise not complicated. You need a second body to support weight while fastening everything back into place. An excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: OldCat

customer_reviews.title: Great other than the beeping noise it makes.
customer_reviews.text: The unit inside the fan beeps LOUDLY whenever you press a button. Frankly, it’s super obnoxious. That said, the price is great and it the operation is flawless. I wonder how hard it would be to open it up and disable the beeping? Now that it is installed I’m too lazy to uninstall and attempt it, but I have it in a spare bedroom. If it was in a bedroom we used often I’d probably be annoyed enough to attempt it.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: BEEP BEEP BEEP
customer_reviews.text: I really don't get how people can stand this thing. BEEEEEEEP! It beeps every time it receives a command! Seriously??? How is that useful? You can always tell if the fan gets slower or faster. Turn off the lights via switch? BEEEP. Lower the fan? BEEEEP Other than that, this thing is fine. It took way too much effort to put the receiver in the canopy, but I think this is common issue. If it didn't beep it would get a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Sia

customer_reviews.title: Super tight fit, but works great.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it installed. It works fine but it is a very tight fit. If you have the kind of fan mount shown in my first photo this device fits tightly. It touches both sides top and bottom of the fan mount. It looks like this device was made specifically to fit this type of mount. I had to loosen the fan mount from the ceiling a little to make room for this. Also the screws that hold up the electric box cover were too long once the receiver switch was installed. I couldn't get that cover quite all the way flush with the ceiling. Otherwise it would be a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Potential install issue with flush mounted ceiling fans
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My only complaint is that my ceiling fan is flush mount (no down-bar) and the receiver is too big to fit in the junction box and there was no room inside the fan housing for this to fit. I basically had to put the controller in the ceiling and have the controller wires come into the junction box (I'm using a ceiling fan brace: Westinghouse Lighting 0110000 Saf-T-Brace for Ceiling Fans, 3 Teeth, Twist and Lock, so could rotate the junction box enough to slip the controller past it). A bit of a PITA but, once installed, it works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick - San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Great remote and timer
customer_reviews.text: Great controller. All the cable colors matched up with what i have for easier installation. Before proceed, please power off both the switch and power source for safety. The labels and instructions are the most important. Beside that, make sure you can find a spot to hide the module. Not every fan has room for this so do your homework. Otherwise, it is super easy to install and operate. Very few buttons and it also has a timer which is great.
customer_reviews.author: SharkBytes

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit
customer_reviews.text: Fit under the ceiling cover perfectly. Tight fit due to wires but moving things around made it all fit. Worked perfectly first time. Easy wiring. Control easy to read. I like the beep that tells me I pushed a button. Some people don't but I think the feedback is perfect. Very nice engineering. Only wish is to have the black remote be a little smaller to fit easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Lover

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine but died in two months
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for two months, but then it died suddenly. I contacted the manufacturer for support and they responded with a suggestion that made it clear they didn't even read my initial email (which was a whopping three sentences long). The unit is large as others have noted, but the electrician who installed it had no trouble getting it to fit in my ceiling fan housing. It also makes an annoyingly loud beep. This would have been a four-star review, but a product that dies in two months is a two-star at best.
customer_reviews.author: James Z.

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote, you have to get one of these.
customer_reviews.text: My ceiling fan in the bed room is wireless (no side chains to control it). My wife loves the fan on high, with the AC down low. I love this remote, because when she asking me to turn the fan on I set the time on it for 4 hours. so in the middle of the night when we are sleeping she does not realize the fan is off, and I can wake up with out freezing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kiser273

customer_reviews.title: Too thick for a replacement but works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! It is much fatter than the one that stopped working on my fan. I had to work very hard until I was able to shove it in, moving wires around and pushing, pushing, pushing... When I finally installed it it works fine. The instructions for a set up are very vague. It tells you to push something in the receiver's hole. There is a hole but there is nothing to push. Just a hole. However when the unit was energized it beeped once and the set up was completed without me pushing anything.
customer_reviews.author: Cotick Somick

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this timer for our Hampton Bay fan light and it works great. We saw one at Lowe's for about $38, so the price is super! Many complain about the "beep" sound when you push any button, but it is not loud enough to even mention for us. I love not having to get out of bed, climb up on my cedar chest and pull chains! We will add this same remote to our other fans in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable and easily installed remote control unit.
customer_reviews.text: These units are programmed to work right out of the box. The installation is relatively easy. I have purchased four of these units and have had them in place for over three years with no problems. When I recently had a problem that I thought was related to the remote control unit, I found out after purchasing a new unit that it was not the controls which was the problem, but one wire that was not connecting from the control unit down to the light assembly. After much trouble shooting I found the culprit, replaced the wire and everything worked as it should. Too bad I had to purchase the new control unit to find out the problem was elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. But neither the instructions nor the online video were accurate for connecting the device. And for those that have never changed a design of something. This unit is no different than most others. It will not work the way the instructions state unless you happen to have the exact same setup as depicted in the advertising. If you are a stickler with everything in it's place, you need to replace the whole fan designed with a remote. Otherwise, just expect some compromises.
customer_reviews.author: David Holt

customer_reviews.title: control works great
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Its important to read the instructs, and not cross the wires. It took me about 15 minutes to get it running. I did need a second set of hands, to help with the fan, but once installed it works great. The controls read the signal. And my favorite part is that is comes with a holder, that I put right next to the bed, at arms reach. It is really easy to install, just 2 screws and you are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: IceQx13

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. It is not wireless. I had a heck of a time returning it. In fact, I still have not been able to return it. I tried four times. Do not waste your time on this product. If you buy it and it doesn't work, it will be a huge hassle to return, at least that was my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Vincent

customer_reviews.title: High Pitch Beep
customer_reviews.text: The unit that fits in the fan housing is a little large and was hard to fit in the space. Everything had to be lined up perfectly and wires out of the way or you can't get the cover back on that conceals the wiring. One that was accomplished and I used the remote this loud annoying beep sounds every time you select a setting. For this reason I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr TV

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: Controller that goes inside the fan housing was just a bit long for my fan. It fit but was pretty tight. Super easy to install otherwise for me. Remote works great. Make sure that you hang the antenna wire outside of the fans metal housing or your remote will have a bad time. I hate that the battery for the remote is a large watch-type. A couple of triple A batteries would not have made the remote much larger. Two stars off for battery type. Add one star for including said battery. Have only had it in use for 45 days. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dablox

customer_reviews.title: Receiver to large to fit Hampton Bay fan bracket from Home Depot
customer_reviews.text: Unable to install because receiver is too large to fit mounting bracket. I have installed at least 5 similar wireless fan receivers in the past and they are always tough to install, but eventually can be made to fit. Could not get this one to fit. Can't comment on its operation since it was never installed. Another complaint that I would have is that the mounting bracket for the handheld remote has a bracket that does not overlap with your common wall switch plate. In other words, the screws are in different locations.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schuyler

customer_reviews.title: This is a great remote!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install and has intuitive control buttons. It was hard to get the controller to fit, but because of the fan design not this controller. Once I was able to angle the controller in above the fan mounting bracket after a bit of rerouting the wires, it fit like a glove and works perfect. I use it every night when going to sleep. Nice design and great functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE the fan in my home office & had no idea what was wrong with it when it stopped working. My handy man came to replace it with one I purchased and found out this particular part was what was wrong ! THANK YOU, now it works GREAT :-)
customer_reviews.author: smileslopez

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cheap price!!!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I’m an average Joe that does research before I buy. I don’t like to spend a lot of money, but I will if quality calls for it. With that said, this was the cheapest price point for this type of unit and I must say it works flawless! Installation was a breeze and the looks of the remote are second to none. I normally don’t write reviews, but had to for this!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Norden

customer_reviews.title: Good value - does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest challenge was getting the cover plate back on. I'm so glad I based part of my selection on the size of the receiver. The remote works perfectly with my 3 speed fan. I don't know if the speeds vary from the matching manufacturer wall control as I was previously using it with a simple On-Off switch at full speed only.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Konietzny

customer_reviews.title: Does the job exactly as it is advertized, just one gripe...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I can stop the beep sound which occurs on each key press. Some user has explained how to remove speak but I didn't want to open the unit for that. Ideally, if there was a switch either on the remote or in the unit itself, would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Strong Head

customer_reviews.title: Great creature comfort item.
customer_reviews.text: Works great I replaced a combination light and fan switch that had broken. The one thing that I think the fan unit is missing is a couple of eyelets so that you can use plastic ties to secure it to the fan mounting bracket, this is the reason that I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. It is so nice not to have to get and down to adjust the lights or the fan speed. I call this a creature comfort tool.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate lazy tool
customer_reviews.text: Love it, hubby didn't think it would fit under the housing and almost didn't put it up, but youtubed how to install and it fits! So don't give up. We now can't turn off light or fan without the remote but that could be installer issue or the fact out light switch is a dimmer styled one. All in all, I love it. 8 months pregnant and getting up and down isn't as easy, imagine it will be good for when baby is here too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OneSelect instead of 3
customer_reviews.text: This item came on time, well packed and is a perfect replacement for my previous bedroom remote. I could select a particular speed without having to keep clicking 3 times to go to high speed or 3 times to go to low speed. I particular like the 1-3 hour timer, where you could leave the fan on for 1 or 3 hours and you if you leave the room, the fan turns itself off after your selection. I save battery with the item as well as energy.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Unnecessary beeping
customer_reviews.text: Pros: price and easy install if you have enough room for the receiver. For my install, I had to shove the receiver in pretty good for it to fit. Not sure why they can’t make these receivers smaller. Good range and works from all angles within view. Cons: when you turn lights and/or fan on/off the receiver beeps with a pretty high pitch. Completely unnecessary. Happy with the purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Best remote I've tried
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the crap one they carry at home Depot. This works flawlessly and has not given us any issues at all. Bought our first one about 6 months ago. Wish the wires were a little longer to make install easier but I can get over that since it works so good.
customer_reviews.author: Tom4rmMarketing

customer_reviews.title: Beeps Every Time
customer_reviews.text: The functionality of this device is fine, and we like all the features, however it has a small electronic beep whenever you turn it on or change the setting, which is annoying and terrifies our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rsqbob

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement fan remotes.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to replace several remotes that my ex-wife threw out to spite me. A little thicker than the original pieces that go inside the fan head but was able to install fairly easily and without any issues. Used 5 in the same house without interference problems.
customer_reviews.author: jdietz

customer_reviews.title: Every fan should have one!!
customer_reviews.text: Every fan should have one. This is an inexpensive way to not have to mess with figuring out which chain to pull and how many times to pull it to get the desired fan speed. I installed 2 of these in rooms with high ceilings so a remote was a must. I have only been using this product for about a month. I will edit my review if an issue arises.
customer_reviews.author: JJN

customer_reviews.title: Works great,. Had audible beep
customer_reviews.text: Works great,. Had audible beep. Only thing I don't care for is the battery. I'm 39 and I've never seen a 23A size battery!? Why couldn't they use AAA... Ugh .... After using for a few months, I'm starting to regret my purchase. The holder doesn't secure it well. Everytime it falls, the battery cover comes off and battery shoots out. Keep in mind it's falling on carpet. The biggest problem is when I turn the light off, sometimes, it turns the fan on. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N. Wiktor

customer_reviews.title: It seems to work ok once it's installed, but ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work ok once it's installed, but it is almost impossible to install after you already have the fan up. There isn't even a hair of wiggle room, and it took me several tries to get the wiring to fit with the remote in the small space. And the description for this item should say in bold "beeps when you push the buttons!" I would never have bought this had I known (a) that it beeps, and (b) the beeps come from the fan itself, not the remote.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Good remote control
customer_reviews.text: Works fine overall with a sleek design and good functionality. The only drawback and gotcha is that it always resets itself after you turn off the wall switch. So next time you come in the room and turn on the lights using a switch in the room last settings that were set by this remote for the light / fan will not be remembered.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren F.

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fit with Brightwatts Ceiling Fan
customer_reviews.text: This was an add-on to the following product - Energy Efficient 52 Inch LED Ceiling Fan with Nutmeg Espresso Blades and White Glass Light Bowl by Brightwatts. It would not fit in its casing like it said it would. Had to return it. They need to remove this from their product add-on list.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: died after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: remote would not operate anything after 1 month. very poor quality. also was annoying is it beeped everytime you pushed a button. could not shut that off. they offered to send me another but i dont want to have to install again and the beeping was a deal breaker
customer_reviews.author: Darren O

customer_reviews.title: a little large but works good.
customer_reviews.text: a little big so couldnt fit it into my ceiling fan canopy but it works as advertised and I was able to train my Bond to control this and hence make my ceiling fan a smart ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: ale

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to install, instructions were clear and easy to follow, timer function is great as I can set it to turn off in the middle of the night when it gets a little colder, and most important for me is the remote control, my house doesn’t have a light switch in my room, had to be pulling a chain, this has made life so much easier. It’s really convenient
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty/expert level to install. But when it's in its AMAZING.
customer_reviews.text: My dad is a handy man and we did it together. I feel this would be hard for those new to tearing a fan down and getting to the receiver in the fan. Definitely get a handyman. But once it's in, its responsive, comes with a holder, timer, different speeds and a light switch. Makes our lives so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sisi

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and looks nice and works great
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure about installation but our electrician did it and it works really great! I’m very happy with the looks of it too, it’s very well made.. better than the ones that come with most fans!
customer_reviews.author: LISA LOUTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works better than OEM  part. Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the original, fit exactly the same dimensions as the Hunter 27185-86 that was in it. Bought a new original oem and it wouldn’t code and the signal was to weak to work when the remote was in the holder. BUY THIS ONE SAVE $30. IT WORKS GREAT. Pull your old one out and check dimensions before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Stevec77

customer_reviews.title: Saves additional work
customer_reviews.text: This product saved my behind! I had recessed lights controlled by one switch but i wanted to add a fan. The fan i bought came with a remote but the receiver did not have a light option. Therefore the lights would need to be on for the fan to work and i hated that. I did not want to tear up sheetrock to lay wire and add another switch. Bought this new receiver and it works great! Lights and fan can be turned on separately from the remote. The only annoyance is the loud beep when you press a button but ill deal with it!
customer_reviews.author: Felix Salzedo

customer_reviews.title: Good controller, but with annoying "Beep"
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and operates well, but it has an annoying "Beep" sound that comes from the fan whenever you push a button on the controller. Moved it from the living room to my workshop where the noise isn't objectionable.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: You would think with the price the quality would not be up to par, but I think it is very good. Super easy to install. The remote doesn’t feel like it will break with holding it. Have had it for about 3 months and has worked perfectly. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: SunglassSmiles

customer_reviews.title: Good product worth of money
customer_reviews.text: Its good cheaper option if you are looking to convert your normal fan/lights with remote. Though instructions were not so helpful but product works thats the imp thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sumit V.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this remote for the money, operates my hunter fan perfectly, I would like it if they made a in wall switch version with same functionality, Really like the timer function.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t DIMM but does BEEP!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t dimm the lights like every other fan remote kit I’ve ever used. That’s annoying. Also, it beeps very loud with every button press, so don’t adjust fan speed if someone’s sleeping! Lastly, the receiver that goes in canopy is a bit large. It took some magic to fit it. I have to wonder if anyone actually uses these items in the design stages.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T. Berggren

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Could not get the fan to go higher than the lowest speed. The light stopped working after installing the remote and still doesn't work after removing it. Returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B

customer_reviews.title: This was extremely easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely easy to install. I put it in my Father in Laws stocking on Christmas night, and then installed it for him in an hour when he wanted me to. He can now control his bedroom light and fan from his bed. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevan

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: So for the product is working perfectly, looks like good quality. Is quite easy to install following the instructions and if you have some knowledge with electricity, if not hire a professional.
customer_reviews.author: eze 1906

customer_reviews.title: Great add on device
customer_reviews.text: Device works great as expected. It be nice if the device was little smaller, it barely made into the housing. There is a beep when you press on the button. Be good if the beep can be option to turn on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Was worried that it wouldn't work for my Harbor Breeze fan but it did. I had to change the way it mounts slightly but it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: fxrsniper

customer_reviews.title: Battery often comes loose, speeds seem slower
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and appears to be the standard size, but even the directions warn that the battery could come loose. This can occur when setting the remote down. After a couple of times, I finally placed a small piece of paper in the battery compartment between the battery and the battery door.
customer_reviews.author: LCSpotcake

customer_reviews.title: Not UL Listed
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere on the box or the unit does it say it is UL listed, which means it really isn't legal to sell in the US. The beeping is ANNOYING. I will have my husband remove that component. You pay for what you get, if you want nicer, more reliable, go with name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffer

customer_reviews.title: Little things keep it from being perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad product as it does exactly what it should. The wires where labeled for installation and pre-stripped which make things easy. Wire nuts would have been nice, since you need more than if you just installing a fan. Pros: Works as it should, wires pre-stripped and labeled Cons: No wire nuts, unit beeps on button press with no option to turn it off, the batteries in the remote are an odd size.
customer_reviews.author: Evan  Thomas

customer_reviews.title: BEEP!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, one anoyance is the power failed in the middle of the night and it went BEEP. It will not return to it's previous setting , just another beep to wake you up.
customer_reviews.author: pm

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement receiver for low cost
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for my current nonworking fan receiver. The install for this was super easy. And I am so pleased with the functions and features the receiver has. Great price as well!
customer_reviews.author: Capricious

customer_reviews.title: Tricky installation, loud beep
customer_reviews.text: The install was time consuming and barely fit my 52" comet. I had to route my wires carefully. I chose this over the original manufacturers remote because it was smaller. But other than that this product works and makes me happy
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than Home Depot!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had an electrician do some upgrades. Buying this on Amazon was a lot cheaper than Home Depot. Installed fine, works well
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Anderson

customer_reviews.title: No frills universal kit
customer_reviews.text: So this works like a charm with my Hampton bay fan. But the reason this is better than the rest is because the remote uses standard 433Mhz RF protocol which makes using these with DIY projects possible. Also, very little humming sound compared with some other receivers.
customer_reviews.author: prv008

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: It was a tight fit in our older fan but fit it did and it works perfectly. We haven’t used the timer. The remote is a good size and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: B. McConn

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from that kit
customer_reviews.text: One star for the extremely bad product, the second to the Amazon for the return process. The first kit worked for about 20 days. The second one never worked from the start, replaced it with the third one, wasn't work either. I ordered different model which is working for now.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Universal fit great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great deal especially considering the more expensive versions are private labeled knockoffs so save the $$ and go with this.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: Unit is a little thicker than unit it is replacing, made it difficult to fit inside cover but was able to make it work without installing in attic. Operates well so far. Seems to be a good unit at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Good producy
customer_reviews.text: Great product fit nicely and functions better than most on the market only not is range needs to be more sensitive to be a blaster an electrician know how will make this work great a simple homeowner may not know.. as an electrican 5 stars current rating homeowner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: gotta use remote only.
customer_reviews.text: in order for this to work right you have to use the remote on with both switches on or one switch will kill light and fan. I think most if not all same way. good support
customer_reviews.author: GJZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and good remote
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the black box tranmitter on an older fan in the bedroom. Old unit had no AC ouput. It worked very well and the new remote is so much better than the old unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar T. Winters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for overpriced hunter gear
customer_reviews.text: Works better than original equipment. Instant response. First button push every time. Easy install. The little beep it makes with every push is annoying or would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: AaronG

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this product .. Light Switch portion quick working after 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: In the first 5 weeks I used this fan remote about twice a week (winter here and no fan usage). The light switch on/off button has now stopped working. I bypassed the light button and went back to controlling the light via the wall switch. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Beachboydan

customer_reviews.title: Product seem to last about 1 yr.
customer_reviews.text: Easy use, easy intall. 1 year until failure with 0 support... The light function fails. Would not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Kjell H.

customer_reviews.title: Should of done this a year ago when I bought my house!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 units for all my rooms. Easy to install. Would of liked the remote to use a double a or triple a battery instead of the special 23a. Great so far will update down the line if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Banjö

customer_reviews.title: Fits!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and we were concerned about it fitting at first, but this fit in our fan just great and will fit in any standard sized fan!
customer_reviews.author: Golkak

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well, not the best looking or most expensive quality wise but works for the intended purpose. The beep is extremely annoying, best to use in a room you're not in or have to adjust frequently
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Only set back was that this remote won't dim the light kit, its either on or off
customer_reviews.text: Only set back was that this remote won't dim the light kit, its either on or off. Other then that it turns on the 3 speeds of the fan. It was my fault for assuming that they all work the same, as far as the dimming of the light. It arrived fast and it worked out of the box. TY
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect but does not dim light
customer_reviews.text: After contacting Hunter's customer service twice I almost bought theirs at $50 + S&H ... I hung up the phone, opened Amazon and purchased this item through Prime. I got it in two days and installed it in half an hour. Works perfect with my Hunter ceiling fan mod#59039. The only issue is that the light does not dim anymore but everything else is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: moz

customer_reviews.title: Works like charm.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and works just fine, exactly like the OE model for 1/2 the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We had a light switch that was behind a bookcase and we had to always reach behind it to control the fan and light. This solved the problem. You can turn on one or the other from the remote, control speed and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Item. Worked for about 40 seconds than died.. Still waiting for my refund
customer_reviews.author: foot

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of equipment so far...
customer_reviews.text: It's only been installed for a week, but was easy to install (according to my electrician). I didn't give it 5 stars b/c the remote beeps. I wish it was silent.
customer_reviews.author: JenLG

customer_reviews.title: Too big!
customer_reviews.text: Very large. Had to remove the extra large plastic case and make my own. They need to slim down the case, no need for it to be so big. Otherwise works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

product_meta.title: PECHAM Universal Lamp Kit & Timing Wireless Remote Control for Ceiling Fan, Scope of Application [Home/Office/Hotel/The Club/Display Hall/Restaurant]
feature_bullets: Installation is very easy and fast, It is a nice looking remote and with rubber textured buttons that are easy to press and it comes with a holster you can mount to the wall

Includes separate buttons for 3 fan speeds,designed to separately control your ceiling fan speed and light switch; Includes wall cradle for handheld remote control,This kit converts regular ceiling fan into a remote controllable one
Operates to a distance of up to 49-feet.Works with down rod mounted fans; receiver mounts in fan canopy
Important Notice: we put the dimension of receiver in pictures, plesse view it carefully and make sure there is enough space in the canopy of your fan
Our Total Customer Satisfaction - Thank you for making us the PECHAM ceiling fan remote control. If you are not satisfied, simply contact us to request a refund or exchange!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars724 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
